reviewText:
Ok, so the engine for this game is not a very good one.

I have twice now encountered such dramatic slow downs in the game that I have had to close the program.

A part of it is that there appears to be no limitations to the number of enemies the Plague Lord can spawn, ending up with hundreds of maggots blocking all shots to the Lord himself he becomes invincible and can continueto spawn even more maggots.

That is incredibly bad.

The other involves the Earth Magician, who when creating his spikes of earth shooting upwards from the ground towards me, slows not just the game down, but the sound down.  Something even the thousand maggots could not do.

In its current state I would say to avoid the title entirely, hopefully in the future they iron out these and other issues.

The game is not bad beyond that, it is a somewhat average Binding of Isaac kind of game.

reviewText: really cool game for any fans of binding of isaac, with some added extras like creating your own dungeons and horde mode with daily leaderboards

I've only had this game for a short time, bit I'm enjoying it immensely! It's fun!! Responsive controls, fun premise and play, and good homage to other rogue-like titles makes Hashtag Dungeons work wonderfully well. You have LOTS of choices for difficulty, easy access to levels made by other players, and the tie-in to Twitter is more enhancement than annoyance...as it seems some folks may be a bit wary of that. I wanted to offer input early on, this being a new game at the time of this review...so even with little playing time in, it is an easy call to give Hashtag Dungeon a thumbs up...and with MANY games in my personal collection it's pretty easy to predict that this here game is a winner. So....great fun and astounding potential for re-playability adds to a game that is great for short runs or long ones and honors the procedurally generating rogue-like dungeon crawler genre while offering a fresh take by utilizing social media to enhance ever-new levels. Enthusiastic thimbs up from me!!

Product received for free

A great little game with huge potential.
This retro-style dungeon crawler uses twitter as a medium to create and share game levels.
I personally belive this game has a huge amount of playablitly although it can become a little bit grindey whilst you're saving for a new character.
Pros
.Great sound track and art
.endless
.innovative

Cons
. requires twitter
. can become a grind fest

reviewText:
Product received for free

Hashtag dungeon is an interesting innovation using twitter for the storage of user generated levels. Offering daily challenges with a scoreboard within the horde mode alongside an in-built dungeon generator offering a range of difficulties to the player.

Whilst like most games it does contain a few issues such as being a little grindy at times and the 30 fps limit I would recommend you to give it a try if you are a fan of the games genre.

reviewText: As someone who doesn't have a twitter account, I still found this game super enjoyable since you can still play other peoples' or the randomly generated dungeons. Gameplay was easy to pick up, super fun and a great way to kill some spare time.

reviewText: This is a fun game that uses twitter to make levels and full dungeons. I've had a lot of fun with it and it has gotten better and better with each new release. Nice pixel perfect graphics and excellent sound. If you like dungeon crawlers and showing off good scores, this is the game for you. It's also fun just playing the player made levels.
